intro: Dactylus spicatus, commonly known as the spiny dactylus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Dactylus spicatus is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
